entry.title: blink: Send new isolates into background as well
entry.content:
CL https://crrev.com/c/4660433 started sending notifications about

the foreground/background state to worker isolates.



However, new worker isolates may be created after notifications

were sent and would therefore never be sent into the background.



This CL track isolate visibility and will send background

notifications on worker creation.



Bug: v8:14174

entry.title: Revert "[Auto-disable Accessibility] Deprecate the old isTouchExplorationEnabled method"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8093792e931a2fb10d09d74b630356addca2925d.



Reason for revert: Caused crbug.com/1472661 - confirmed that reverting locally fixed test failures.



Original change's description:

> [Auto-disable Accessibility] Deprecate the old isTouchExplorationEnabled method

>

> This CL continues the work of consolidating accessibility state to a

> single source in Clank.

>

> With this CL we update all callers of isTouchExplorationEnabled to the

> equivalent method in AccessibilityState. For some methods we instead

> migrate to isScreenReaderEnabled, since it more accurately represents

> the condition that was meant to be checked. We keep the original method

> in place but add a @Deprecated annotation to discourage use.

>

> AX-Relnotes: N/A

> Bug: 1430202, b/265493191

> Change-Id: Ib0c6194bca1ae734c30dc96b41d12de69e9b2145

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4748989

> Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

> Reviewed-by: Theresa Sullivan

> Commit-Queue: Mark Schillaci

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1182796}

entry.title: [Sync] Wait for invalidations handling in download status
entry.content:
This CL adds an additional check to the download status API to make it

sure that the sync engine is listening for invalidations. Otherwise, the

API could return kUpToDate status even when the engine hasn't started

interacting with the server.

entry.title: [OOBE] Add UserCreation to priority screens
entry.content:
Add UserCreation to priority screens so that it’s displayed faster,

before the rest of OOBE is loaded. Make sure that all styles are

configured correctly, and that buttons are displayed without delay.



Additionally, update the logic deciding which labels to display, and

if the back button should be shown, to rely directly on the flow type

(first run vs. add-person).

entry.title: [file manager] Add label for open-encrypted action
entry.content:
Context menu item label for the default action is set in the frontend

part of the Files App if action itself is handled by the Files App.

Such actions are, for example, `open-hosted-gdoc` or `open-encrypted`

for opening entries in Google Docs/Google Drive web interfaces.



Unfortunately, the code which annotates the label missed the

`open-encrypted` action, this change fixes this.

internal call to P2PSocket::OnError, so do not reference this after

SendPacket returns false.

entry.title: Replace permissions::PermissionResult with content::PermissionResult
entry.content:
PermissionController is placed in //content and cannot access

components/permissions hence we had to move PermissionResult from

//components to //content. This CL finishes migration by removing the

old permission_result.* files and cleaning up no-longer-used conversion

methods.

entry.title: Revert "Add indexing-exclusions.txt"
entry.content:
This reverts commit a53591654c886b17f160eec3b29ca30e2f507664.



Reason for revert: This CL blocks the Canary release on Windows

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1472646



Original change's description:

> Add indexing-exclusions.txt

>

> tools/symsrc/indexing-exclusions.txt contains a list of directories that

> source indexing should ignore. Currently this contains just one

> directory, but having that entry avoids 297 calls to "git log" for files

> that aren't controlled by git, and that, for some reason, saves almost

> two hours. The non-comment lines in this file are read by the

> pdb_processing.py script in the recipe and then passed to

> source_index.py.

>

> This change also adds a comment in source_index.py to make this

> discoverable, and updates the link to the recipe code.

>

> This relies on:

> https://chrome-internal-review.googlesource.com/c/chrome/tools/release/scripts/+/6303779

>

> Bug: 1471723

entry.title: Store ProfileTokenQuality observations in AutofillTable.
entry.content:
For every stored type, AutofillProfile::token_quality() stores a set of

up to 10 observations. An observation consist of an ObservationType,

which is the value of a small enum, and a 1 byte hash used for some

deduplication.

This CL adds logic that persists this information in AutofillTable.



As per [1], the data is simply serialized as a 20 byte blob and stored

in a single column (rather than creating one row per observation).



This CL thus:

- Adds an "observations" column to the tables

contact_info_type_tokens and local_addresses_type_tokens. These are

used to store account and local profiles, respectively.

- Adds ProfileTokenQuality::SerializeObservationsForStoredType() and

LoadSerializedObservationsForStoredType(), which (de)serializes the

observations for storage.

- Updates the CRUD operations in AutofillTable to take the new column

into account.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1BkRRm3-mBHmVJ27lORyzuDhtW6BtxwrBRtQMXEOZNkw/edit?usp=sharing



Bug: 1453650

Change-Id: I0ab7e95e6a0fbf4cc16128fef4c39b116365b17c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4720559

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

entry.content:
Hide the Battery Saver toolbar icon when ChromeOS Battery Saver is

available. The icon only controls a subset of ChromeOS's battery Saver

features, so we should hide it to avoid confusing users. Battery Saver

status will be shown on the battery icon in the shelf on ChromeOS

instead.

entry.title: Lacros: Add the option to use policy from disk
entry.content:
On Ash the provider for policy from disk is the main policy provider

with the highest priority. In Lacros, before this change, the platform provider was the policy_from_ash provider. This made Lacros not support the policy from disk.



In this CL we update Lacros to work like Ash, having the platform provider the policy from disk provider. And the policy_from_ash provider is created separately and added to the list of providers as the second in priority.



Additionally we change the initialization of policy from disk provider on Chrome OS to be done only if the folder for policies exists.



Bug: 1450574

TEST=XDG_RUNTIME_DIR=/tmp/ash_chrome_xdg_runtime

./out_linux_cros/Release/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/ash-chrome

--enable-wayland-server --no-startup-window --login-manager

--login-profile=user --enable-features=LacrosOnly

--enable-ash-debug-browser

--lacros-chrome-path=${PWD}/out_linux_cros/Release/lacros_clang_x64/

--lacros-chrome-additional-args=--disable-gpu####--no-sandbox

entry.title: Attempt to fix dangling pointer in TestAutofillManagerWaiter.
entry.content:
This CL is a speculative fix for a flaky dangling pointer inside

TestAutofillManagerWaiter.



While TestAutofillManagerWaiter observes AutofillManager destruction

events, it currently does not null its reference to the AutofillManager

immediately. Instead, it calls RunLoop::Quit(). It appears that the

call to Quit() can spawn another task that actually quits the run

loop - see the code of RunLoop::Quit().

This CL therefore replaces the reference by a pointer and nulls it

explicitly when the AutofillManager it is observing is destroyed.



Bug: 1468967

Change-Id: I6411872cc436feb5fc49f14e90b40e66ff40a928

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4770941

Reviewed-by: Christoph Schwering

entry.title: Check session id when the AppWindowShelfItem is selected.
entry.content:
When task ids and session ids are empty, and no windows, AppWindowShelfItem is closed. So we can't check task ids only when

calling NOTREACHED in

AppServiceAppWindowShelfItemController::ItemSelected.



Check whether session ids are empty before calling NOTREACHED.



b:287137418

entry.title: Reland "SearchPre: [N.1] use refptr to keep StreamingSearchPrefetchURLLoader alive during serving."
entry.content:
[To Sheriff]

Feel free to revert this CL if it is failing on "Linux ASan LSan Tests

(1)"



This is a reland of commit f626b7fd02f281a3ae4c59e5b420ee36f053a4dc

I tried locally with asan and lsan enabled, but after 1000 runs

no flakiness was catch.

So this CL does:

- Adding another check to report the issue that no record was

reported.

- Modifying the triggering logic to save execution time.

- Ensuring the navigation has been committed.

for better investigation.



Original change's description:

> SearchPre: [N.1] use refptr to keep StreamingSearchPrefetchURLLoader

> alive during serving.

>

> Now SearchPrefetchURLLoader::RequestHandler can be executed

> asynchronously, so it is unsafe to use unique pointer to manage the

> loader's lifetime anymore, and the previous CR comments mentioned.

>

> This CL turns to using a scoped_refptr, so that the loader would not be

> deleted as long as it is still serving.

> And now the lifecycle is managed by Mojo.

>

> https://docs.google.com/document/d/1szrOWEV0KpV5bPpWcru8PwnKioM4kvCkCylxqhX6m8o/edit#bookmark=id.k2il17hzyry5

>

> Bug: 1400881, 1463000

> Change-Id: Ifbb551c222717b824f164bdd7da52aac27978eb4

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4344832

> Commit-Queue: Lingqi Chi

> Reviewed-by: Hiroki Nakagawa

> Reviewed-by: Hiroshige Hayashizaki

> Reviewed-by: Kouhei Ueno

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1180711}



Bug: 1400881, 1463000

entry.title: Make touch handles appear after long tap selection in a Textfield.
entry.content:
CL:4701865 hides the touch handles after a long press gesture, so that

they are not visible during long press drag selection. However, I forgot

to make the touch handles show again after a long tap. (This wasn't

caught by the LongPressSelection test since the event generator

currently generates an extra Tap event after releasing the touch.)

entry.title: [wptrunner] Recognize that wdspec tests have subtests
entry.content:
Over time, the assumption that only `testharness` tests have subtests

has become baked into metadata tooling, often using hardcoded test types

and statuses. Now that wptrunner runs `wdspec` tests, which also have

subtests, introduce a single source of truth in `wpt_metadata` for test

type-specific information, which is backed by wptrunner itself.



Also:

* Configure the linter to begin checking `webdriver/` metadata.

* Fix a small bug in `WPTResultsProcessor` where the `wpt_internal/`

check is dead.



Bug: 1414565

Test: `blink_tool.py lint-wpt external/wpt/**/*.ini`

Test: Results are identical with/without this patch.

Change-Id: Ibcf33baff293fcc49c0118f0340a2f191cfed2f2

entry.title: Adjust audio service sandbox for ScreenCaptureKit
entry.content:
The ScreenCaptureKit API requires access to the ReplayKit daemon. TCC access is not needed as the in-process permission checks can be bypassed, due to the permissions being checked by system services anyway.



This sandbox adjustment is the first step required for the new system

audio loopback capture implementation for macOS which will be landing

soon.



Design doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1v-or4bSTeBjnO5nQe4lNRWtSBAOjD-7coYgqSucg1mU



Bug: 1038436

Change-Id: I9ac799ab68855a9a094918e55f595522f3ce85cd

responsible to keep track what ServiceWorkerRegistration should respond

state.

entry.title: [scroll-gutter] Remove unreachable code in RequiresScrollableArea
entry.content:
This logic was introduced in:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2404233



When the "force" value could apply to non-scrollers. See:

https://web.archive.org/web/20200704215227/https://drafts.csswg.org/css-overflow-4/#scrollbar-gutter-property



However scrollbar-gutter (now) only applies to scrollable containers

which should be covered by the branch "IsScrollContainer" in the

function.



See:

https://drafts.csswg.org/css-overflow-3/#propdef-scrollbar-gutter

entry.title: graphite: Use GpuPreferences Dawn toggles in DawnContextProvider
entry.content:
Use the Dawn toggles passed via GpuPreferences i.e. from command line

flags --enable/disable-dawn-features. This allows passing useful toggles

for debugging such as use_user_defined_labels_in_backend for release

builds. This should also allow enabling validation in release builds by

passing --disable-dawn-features=skip_validation since enabled toggles

are processed first before disabled toggles.



This change also makes the --enable_dawn_backend_validation flag the

source of truth for backend validation level as opposed to the previous

behavior of always enabling full backend validation for dcheck builds.

This is desirable because many GPU bot configs run dcheck builds and

using full backend validation will slow them down a lot.



Bug: 1471235

Change-Id: Iadf290056db08b1abeb708d9e2d3a69ace45fbe9

entry.title: Reliable scroll hit test with opaque-to-hit-test layer
entry.content:
When a layer's scroll parent is different from the first scroller in

layer order, previously we treated scroll-begins in such a layer

unreliable because whether to scroll the scroll parent or the first

scroller in layer order depends on the hit test opaqueness of the

layer, and the compositor didn't have the information. Now the

compositor can reliably scroll the scroll parent if the layer is known

to be opaque to hit test. This CL is effective when the feature

HitTestOpaqueness is enabled.



Bug: 1413877

entry.title: [lacros] Add lacros impl of ScreenCaptureNotificationUI
entry.content:
Today lacros shares the same ScreenCaptureNotificationUI impl

(screen_capture_notification_ui_views) with non-chromeOS platforms,

i.e. it displays a notification bar which appears as a separate

window in overview mode on ChromeOS; it's the issue this cl is about to

address.



This CL makes lacros align with Ash by adding

ScreenCaptureNotificationUILacros that no longer displays a notification

bar but a notification toast in system tray.



Today:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/5fSYdUJw6kRR233.png

entry.title: Use native fling curve inside large snap areas.
entry.content:
SnapFlingController can intercept a fling if it finds a valid snap

target. But inside a snap area that covers the viewport, every offset

is a valid snap target.



Letting SFC control these flings displaced "native" (browser-side) fling

physics in favor of settling the scroll at a distance provided by

SnapFlingCurve::EstimateDisplacement, which is 40x the delta in the

first inertial GestureScrollUpdate. This feels like molasses.



Instead, tell SFC to ignore flings that are estimated to settle inside a

snap area that covers the viewport, unless the current event's actual

delta would take us outside the snap area (see comments in test).



Bug: 1420413

Change-Id: Ie15afe4ad829ee5a64afd0da435c35aa6a279d47

entry.title: IndexedDB: fix flakiness in database metadata initialization
entry.content:
Grab a lock for the database when initializing metadata from the

backing store.



Previous to this change, the metadata for an `IndexedDBDatabase`

object would be read from the backing store (or generated and written

into the backing store, if the database didn't already exist) just

after construction. However the record for that database's metadata,

which contains the version among other info, may be in flux. That is,

a previous connection to the database may have left behind changes

that haven't been fully written. (See bug for exact details.) Thus

the read must be guarded by acquiring the same lock that is used to

write the metadata record.



Bug: 1472028

Change-Id: I373ffa7696b0976efcb544be13dc09ac9b487049

entry.title: Make Length-resolving functions from SVGLengthContext free functions
entry.content:
Said functions only depend on SVGViewportResolver for resolving

percentages. Since creating a SVGViewportResolver is slightly ergonomic

in most cases - especially when there's a LayoutObject available since

it then avoids the To(...) - move these functions out from

SVGLengthContext, making them free.



Add an additional helper for the case when a pair of Lengths should

resolve to a point.



Move SVGViewportResolver and the functions to a separate file, and clean

up the related includes a bit.

entry.title: [Fuchsia] Fine tuning fuchsia-code-coverage builder
entry.content:
This change adjusted fuchsia-code-coverage to hopefully make it green.

1) All/SitePerProcessBrowserTest.AccessWindowProxyOfCrashedFrameAfterNavigation

is failing consistently recently. But it's passing on rel and dbg

builders. Likely the root cause is either crash due to OOM or race

condition. But since this is the coverage builder, skipping it would

be the easiest solution.

2) Further increase the sharding of content_browsertests and

web_engine_integration_test, both of them still have a certain chance

of failing due to the OOM. The retrying indeed wastes more resources.

It would be more meaningful to allocate more shards upfront.

entry.title: [Extensions] Track active service worker keepalives
entry.content:
Track active service worker keepalives in the ProcessManager. This

will both allow us to audit this state (e.g., exposing it in

chrome://extensions-internals) and allows us to add strong CHECKs

to verify call validity (e.g., that a UUID corresponds to a valid

entry).



Add a basic end-to-end browsertest for the same.



Followup CLs will utilize these more fully (such as hooking into

extensions-internals).
